text: Barton Lee Hazlewood (July 9, 1929 â€“ August 4, 2007) was an American country singer, songwriter and record producer. He was most famous for writing the song These Boots Are Made For Walking for Nancy Sinatra. He was born in Mannford, Oklahoma. Hazlewood died of kidney cancer on August 4, 2007 in Henderson, Nevada at the age of 78. ==Other websites== *Article about his death at the BBC Website Category:1929 births Category:2007 deaths Category:Deaths from kidney cancer Category:Cancer deaths in Nevada Category:American record producers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American country singers Category:Singers from Oklahoma
title: Lee Hazlewood
